item.title: MDL and Neural Networks
item.description: Minimum Description Length ( MDL MDL is a measure of how well a model compresses data by minimizing the combined cost of the description of the model and the misfit. ) can be used to construct a concise network. A fully connected network has great expressing power but it is easily overfitting. One strategy is to apply constraints to the networks: Limit the connections; Shared weights in subgroups of the network; Constrain the weights using some probability distributions.
